special_cp.overview: Vivillon's has 2097 max CP (at Level 50). A Vivillon obtained from Raids can be encountered from 997 CP to 1060 CP, or if weather boosted, in the 1247 CP to 1325 CP range. In Field and Special Research, Vivillon can be found in the 748 CP to 795 CP range.
more_info: Field and Special Research encounters are always Level 15. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Field Research encounters have a 10/10/10 IV floor.
Pok√©mon hatched from Eggs are always Level 20. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Egg Hatches have a 10/10/10 IV floor.
Raid Bosses caught without weather boost are always Level 20. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Raid Catches have a 10/10/10 IV floor. üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.
üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.

Raid Bosses caught with weather boost are always Level 25. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Weather boosted Raid Catches have a 10/10/10 IV floor. üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.
üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.
Wild encounters range from Level 1 to Level 30 Pok√©mon. Their IVs range from 0 (min) to 15 (max) for each stat.

Weather Boosted wild Pok√©mon encounters get a 5 Level boost, bringing their Level range to Level 6 to Level 35. In addition, they have a guaraneed minimum IV value of 4 for each stat, resulting in a 4/4/4 IV floor.

mega_boost.title: Mega Pok√©mon that boost Vivillon
mega_boost.intro_text: A list of Mega Pok√©mon that boost Vivillon's Bug and Flying-type moves, Candy, and Candy XL from catching Vivillon.

bonus_info.raid_bonus: Mega and Primal Raid Bonus ‚Äì Mega Pok√©mon boost the attack power of all other Pok√©mon when battling in Raid Battles by 10%. Attacks that share their type with the Mega Pok√©mon's type(s) receive a 30% boost. However, these bonuses do not stack if there are multiple Mega-Evolved Pok√©mon battling simultaneously; only the higher boost will be applied.
bonus_info.catch_bonus: Mega and Primal Catch Bonus ‚Äì While a Pok√©mon is Mega-Evolved, additional XP and Candy is granted when catching a Pok√©mon that shares a type with it, or for any raid boss caught. These do not stack with each other. Additionally, High and Max Level Mega-Evolved Pok√©mon grant an increased chance to obtain Candy XL when catching a Pok√©mon that shares a type with it.

size_info.description: Vivillon's height ranges from 0.3 m to 2.1 m, with the average being 1.2 m. The illustration shows a comparison with a 1.70 m (5‚Ä≤07‚Ä≥) tall Trainer. Max height has been limited to 450px for rendering purposes.

faq.question: What are Vivillon‚Äôs strengths and weaknesses?
faq.answer: As a Bug and Flying-type Pok√©mon, Vivillon is especially weak against Rock-type moves, and weak against Electric, Fire, Flying, and Ice-type moves.

faq.question: What are the best moves for Vivillon in Pok√©mon GO?
faq.answer: The best moves for Vivillon in Pok√©mon GO are Gust and Bug Buzz. This moveset has a DPS (Damage Per Second) of 9.09 and a TDO (Total Damage Output) of 102.488.

faq.question: How does Vivillon perform in Raids?
faq.answer: Vivillon's Raid attacker tier is currently not known, has no viable moves, or it is too low to be ranked.

faq.question: How does Vivillon rank as a Bug-type attacker?
faq.answer: Vivillon is an F-Tier Bug-type attacker and not recommended for Raid battles.

faq.question: How does Vivillon rank as a Flying-type attacker?
faq.answer: Vivillon is an F-Tier Flying-type attacker and not recommended for Raid battles.

faq.question: What Mega Pok√©mon boost Vivillon?
faq.answer: The following Mega Pok√©mon boost Vivillon: Mega Beedrill, Mega Pinsir, Mega Scizor, Mega Heracross, Primal Kyogre, Mega Pidgeot, Mega Pinsir, Mega Aerodactyl, Mega Salamence, and Mega Rayquaza.
